Build Your Vision of Island Perfection – Not only are the graphics enhanced, but 20 new buildings including the stock exchange, shopping mall, aqua park and a mausoleum for El Presidente allow you to craft your perfect balance of beauty and economic efficiency.
State of Emergency – Six new interactive disasters including volcanoes, droughts and tornadoes prove that Mother Nature can be a tougher adversaries than opponents bent on your political ouster.
Council of Ministers – Appoint selected citizens to ministerial posts to help push through and enact your more controversial decisions and edicts.
National Agenda – Receive objectives from Tropican factions, foreign geopolitical powers or opportunities relating to current island events that can further or hamper your dictatorial ambitions.
Facebook and Twitter integration – Post live Tweets directly from the game or create posts automatically upon completion of missions, unlocking achievements, etc. Store and display achievements and screenshots of your ultimate island empire on facebook and compare your Dictator Rankings against others online (Windows PC only feature).




Source: The Publisher Website.

106761.name: 3D Infininty
106761.description:
User Summary

Shoot down enemies with machine guns or missiles in this on rails shooter that supports the use of 3D. Gameplay is similar to Star Fox where you move along a set path dodging obstacles and enemy fire and shooting down enemy ships.

106762.name: King Arthur II: The Role-Playing Wargame
106762.description:
King Arthur II takes the player back to Britannia, not too long after Arthur and his knights defeated their enemies, vowing to turn their lands into a brighter place for all. Alas, things did not work out that way. Arthur suffers from a magical wound which the best healers and magicians have been unable to heal. The Holy Grail is missing and the Knights of the Round Table have disbanded. Some fled, some are rebelling and to make matters even worse, a monstrous race, the strength of which was hinted at in the first game, has emerged. The Formorians are demonic creatures that usually come in the “big and scary” variety and they have their own agenda for Britannia and Arthur.
The player is tasked with creating a new army, one with even stronger knights and with a whole range of new units available to recruit. The most formidable of which are the dragons: hard to kill due to their thick skin and leathery wings and fearsome as they breathe fire and destruction over their targets.

Though the overall concept of King Arthur remains unchanged, Neocore has crammed a ton of changes and a number of innovations into this sequel. You still cruise the map with your knightly heroes and command forces that seem to have stepped right out of a dark fantasy novel. And like before, your actions determine whether you will go down in history as a saint or a tyrant through the game’s deep morality system. At the heart of this system are the quests which come available through diplomacy, adventuring or battle. The more extreme you are in your choice between good or evil, the higher will be the rewards.

King Arthur II is a role-playing wargame.

Source: The Game Website.

106763.name: Serious Sam III
106763.description:
The third in Croteam's wild and fast-paced shooter series, Serious Sam 3: BFE is a glorious throwback to the golden age of first-person shooters where men were men, cover was for amateurs and pulling the trigger made things go boom. Serving as a prequel to the original indie sensation, Serious Sam: The First Encounter, Serious Sam 3: BFE takes place during the Earth's final struggle against Mental's invading legions of beasts and mercenaries. Set against the collapsing temples of an ancient civilization and the crumbling cities of 22nd century Egypt, Serious Sam 3: BFE is an exhilarating fusion of classic twitch shooters and modern gameplay features.

Source: The Developer Website.

106764.name: Circle of Pain
106764.description:
User Summary

You try to move around circles and from one circle to another, catching your opponents from behind to kill them. Upgrade abilities such as speed, power, purchase mines and a grappling hook, and enhance your special abilities.

106765.name: City Siege
106765.description:
User Summary

You control a large number of different military units that can be purchased and upgraded as the game goes on. Each level has several objectives, such as eliminating enemies and not killing civilians, even conserving your ammunition will cost you less money. You will have to pay compensation to the bereaved for the loss of civilians.

106766.name: City Siege 2: Resort Siege
106766.description:
User Summary

This sequel to City Siege includes new levels and additional units. The enemies are also upgraded.

106767.name: Clash of the Olympians
106767.description:
User Summary

Choose between three greek heroes, gain experience as you defend your temple. Upgrade your abilities as you like.

106768.name: Spyro: Attack of the Rhynocs
106768.description:
RPG elements offer more depth than previous Spyro titles, including quests, mini-quests, and a new inventory system, creating more ways to enjoy the Dragon Realms and making this a completely new Spyro experience.

Source: Wikipedia, "Spyro: Attack of the Rhynocs", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106769.name: Color Strike Down
106769.description:
User Summary

Similar game play to a shootemup, you fly around the screen, but rather than shooting you ram your ship into the enemies to defeat them. However if the color of your ship does not match the enemies (red green and blue), you die rather than them. Score big points for quick combos.

106770.name: Spyro: Season of Ice
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
106770.description:
The object of the game is to release fairies from their ice prisons and to progress from realm to realm before defeating Grendor. Spyro starts off in the Autumn Fairy Home one of the four seasonal fairy realms in the game. In the each realm, gems can be collected, critters like sheep can be destroyed for healing butterflies (and some to grant extra lives), special objects (like pumpkins) can be ignited and baskets can broken for more gems.
If the player collects 100% of all the gems and fairies from all levels and realms, they are granted the opportunity to enter a portal to play the extra game "Dragonfly X".

Source: Wikipedia, "Spyro: Season of Ice", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106771.name: Color Defense
106771.description:
User Summary

You control a ship that is locked into place, but can rotate and fire. You can not only change the direction of fire, but also the color. Shooting same color ships makes them shrink, opposite color ships makes them expand. Be careful to line up against the appropriate enemy. You must also upgrade your arsenal and defense. The wrong equipment will be worthless.

106772.name: Spyro 2: Season of Flame
106772.description:
The game's story centers on the abduction of the Dragon Realm's fireflies at the hands of the Rhynocs, causing the dragons to lose their ability to breathe fire. The protagonist of the story, Spyro the Dragon, must recover the fireflies and uncover the culprit behind the firefly theft. Fireflies can be found in many places, either scurrying around in wide-open spaces or hidden behind obstacles. Fireflies can sometimes be received as rewards for performing tasks for the citizens of the Dragon Realms.

Source: Wikipedia, "Spyro 2: Season of Flame", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106773.description:
Recently revised into a deluxe box, Imps Vs. Puppies is a trick-taking game about players competing to smash open the top card of the Crate Deck. The game offers 15 different Imps with various abilities that will trigger at different points of the round. Each of these Imps come in 6 different colors to support the different teams and there is often a pregame draft to pick which Imps are included in the game. The crate deck is also customized with a mixture of points and traps.

Each round has 5 phases which will determine when Imp abilities will trigger and how the round is resolved.
Phase 1- Send Imps: Each player sends an Imp of their choice from their hand to the battle. If the card is sent face it, this means their ability will trigger. Sent face down, their identity is unknown so their strength can be bluffed.
Phase 2- Reveal Imps: Imps that were sent facedown are revealed and any Imps that are matching in strength are sent home immediately.
Phase 3- Ability Phase: Several Imps have abilities that will trigger right before the center crate is smashed.
Phase 4- Smash Crate: The top crate card is revealed and resolved. If the card is a puppy, players put this card in their score pile. If the card is a bomb, the Imp who smashed the crate is killed. There are a number of other traps that could trigger as well, including Ninja Kittens and Mega Bombs.
Phase 5- Cleanup Phase: Players pull any Imps in the Infirmary into their hands and the Imps used that round enter the infirmary.

This continues until the Last Round Puppy is revealed and players count the number of points in their score piles. Ties are broken by the person who smashed the most puppies.
106773.name: Imps Vs Puppies

106774.name: Spider-Man: Mysterio's Menace
106774.description:
The game has 7 stages, each featuring a boss at the end – Hammerhead (who appears at the end of two levels), Big Wheel, Electro, Rhino, Shriek, Scorpion and Mysterio as the final boss. The player can choose between three stages to begin with, each opening a further level after completion and concluding the story for that part of the game with comic book-styled cutscenes. The game allows players to freely web swing, attack with different punches and kicks, and to shoot web at foes to capture or attack them whilst progressing through levels and avoiding obstacles such as razors and fire. The player can collect upgrades to enhance Spider-Man's strength, health and webbing, as well as "suits" that enhance and protect him from certain obstacles.

Source: Wikipedia, "Spider-Man: Mysterio's Menace", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106775.name: Orbital Mech
106775.description:
From the box cover

Orbital Mech™ is a real-time spaceflight simulator designed to be educational as well as entertaining.

As education, Orbital Mech™ gives the user an intuitive grasp of the vagaries of orbital mechanics and the subtleties of orbital maneuvering.

As entertainment, Orbital Mech™ runs the gamut from laid back kinetic video art, to curious amusement, to exciting challenge.

106776.name: Spider-Man: Battle for New York
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
106776.description:
After finding out Spider-Man’s true identity and how he gained his super powers, Norman Osborn tries to recreate the process on himself, thinking that his superior knowledge and access to his ‘Oz Formula’ would get a better result. He then turns himself into the Green Goblin (with a few side effects). Thinking his experiment to be a success, he then starts to use his formula on other people, creating a goblin army. It’s now up to Spider-Man to figure out what’s going on and put a stop to the Goblin’s plans before he can take over New York.

Source: Wikipedia, "Spider-Man: Battle for New York", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106777.name: In-N-Out Opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
106777.description:
(From the back of the box.)

Go directly to In-N-Out Burger. Do not pass up this opportunity to play America's favorite board game with an In-N-Out flavor. It's the all new In-N-Out Opoly Property Trading Game.

...

The In-N-Out Opoly Game is a hamburger lover's dream come true - build your own empire of the most sought after In-N-Out collectibles, menu items, locations, as well as other assets of the company. Players vie to own them all in this very unique In-N-Out Burger game which comes complete with custom pewter tokens, including the celebrated Double-Double burger, an order of fries and the "Burger's up" bugle. Own it all!

This plays similar to Monopoly, but some of the properties are priced differently than the same spaces in Monopoly.

Pewter Tokens: Beverage Cup, In-N-Out Logo, Double-Double, Burger Coin, French Fries, Bugle, Palm Trees, Apron Pin.

This was given as a Christmas gift to In-N-Out employees in the year 2000. This was never sold to the general public.

106778.name: Nations of Barsaive Volume Four: Crystal Raiders
106778.description:
from the back of the book

DEATH FROM ABOVE

The crystal raiders of the high mountains fly their sleek drakkars in search of ripe, rich targets to loot and plunder. With their gleaming crystal armor and weapons they leap from the decks of their ships into battle, bellowing and bashing down their opposition. The dark shadow of their airships is known and feared all across Barsaive. As one of the most formidable naval forces in the province, not even the Therans are safe from their thirst for revenge. They have played a role in every great battle of Barsaive's history, and may do so again as dark clouds of war gather on the horizon.

Nations of Barsaive Volume Four offers gamemasters and players an in-depth look at the troll raider clans that sail Barsaive's skies and prey on the lowlands. this book details the Twilight Peaks, featuring information on the nine most powerful trollmoots in Barsaive, along with and new material for adventures in the world of Earthdawn.

Requires use of the Earthdawn Player's and Gamemaster's Guides.

106779.name: Pyramids in my pocket
106779.description:
One player, the Disciple, must find out which pyramids the other has hidden in his pocket, while the other, the Master, tries to prevent the first from guessing.

On their turn, the disciple asks for a certain color or size. If available, the Master gives them a matching pyramid which they must drop in an Icehouse tube.
On the Master turn, they will give the Disciple any pyramid to drop into the tube.

The game ends either when the Disciple guesses which three pyramids the master has hidden or when the stack of pyramids reaches over the edge of the tube.

106780.description:
200 Steps to Freedom is an educational trivia game based on the American Revolution. The game was published by American Way Games and "copyright" in 1776 (but published in 1977).

The gameboard has two different paths, either the 100 Days or the 100 People path. At the start of the game, the players decide if they would like to play either the 100 Days or the 100 People path. All player tokens are then placed at the start of this path. Each player in turn will roll the die and move the number of spaces on the die. The 100 Days path has 100 different dates on the spaces, while the 100 people has 100 different people listed on the path. The player then must state one or more facts about the person or the date that they landed on, and if they are correct then they would get a point. For example, if they land on December 14, 1782, the player would get a point if they state that The British pulled out of Charleston South Carolina. Once all players finish the selected path then all of the player pawns are then placed back at the start for phase two, the Question phase. The players then move around the track again, only this time when they land on a space they get to answer a multiple choice question from the book that corresponds to their space that they landed on. Every correct answer gets one point. Once all players cross the finish line of the question phase then the player with the most points is the winner.
106780.name: 200 Steps to Freedom

106781.name: Dark Lore
106781.description:
User Summary

Dark Lore is a Challenging text adventure game in which you have to locate the sacred talisman by defeating the Dark Lord. You must solve numerous puzzles, overcome many perils and battle with a host of malicious adversaries before you can triumph.

106782.name: City of Guilds: The Dice Game
106782.description:
The Great City of Andalanshar is once again leaderless. In-fighting amongst the members of the Council of Andals has led to a breakdown in the running of the city, and the guilds are once again flexing their muscles, trying to gain power however they can.

Seeing an opportunity to regain the power they once lost, the great families are rallying support to try and win control of the city.

Each player represents the head of one of the great families, travelling around the city to try and influence the populace, whilst bribing the guilds in order to gain their support.

Players roll dice to gain influence and gold, whilst travelling around the city and using their gold to bribe the guilds. The guilds allow them to change the dice they've rolled.

106783.name: Pyracurse
106783.description:
User Summary

This is an adventure where the player controls 4 characters, 1 muscles, 1 professor, 1 healer and 1 dog (good for digging).

View is 3D (God view). Objective is to explore the South American tomb of Xipe Totec and rescue a lost explorer. This is quite a challenge as the opponents are headless guardians, skulls, scorpions and even aliens!

Teamplay is needed, the player will need all the abilities of his four team members to solve the puzzles he encounters.

106785.name: Pulsator
106785.description:
User Summary

The game consists of 5 mazes, made from simple wall arrangements. The player controls a 'blob' and must escape from each maze after having rescued 5 other blobs. Those have real person names like 'Nigel' but other than that, they're as abstract as the rest of the game.

To get out, the player has some limited use in blasting his way through, though most of the time concise puzzle solving thinking is needed to make his escape.

The hard part are the numbered gates which open by toggles which have to be passed over in certain sequence. There are some baddies present, but those do not represent the real challenge in this game.

106786.name: 3D Dino Dominoes
106786.description:
This game has like objectives, develops matching skills and reinforces hand-eye co-ordination for the children.
The game begins with the slots on the same side and place in the middle of the players.
After deal 7 dominoes to each player and place the rest in a pile where everyone can reach them.
The player with the shortest name starts by slotting together a matching dinosaur with the starter double domino.
Players then take turns to slot matching dinosaur together, ensuring they are the right way up.
If a player cannot go they take another domino from the pile.The winner is the first child to play all their dominoes or, in the event of a stalemate the child with the fewest dominoes remaining.

106787.name: Revolution
106787.description:
User Summary

In this 3D game the player controls a bouncing ball. It bounces on one of the levels which are hanging above each other in open space. When the ball rolls off, one life is lost. On each platform, a puzzle had to be solved, before an automatic elevator will take the ball to the next level.

The puzzles are similar in concept. The player must deactivate two grey boxes set a distance apart from each other. Touching a box with the ball turns it white and deactivates it for a short length of time.
To complete the puzzle, the player must get his ball over to the other grey box and turn this white also before the first block turns grey again.
Besides the extremely short deactivation time limit, each puzzle has various antagonists, some animated some not. Some will try to bump the ball of the platform, others will shoot.

When a new game is started, a new set of puzzles/platform layouts is generated, so no two games are alike.

106788.name: Richelieu's Guide to Entertainment
106788.description:
From the publisher:

The Roman motto of “bread and circuses” neatly encompassed two crucial points of running a society: the people remain generally content if fed and entertained. France may be suffering great hardship, but for now, her citizens can still enjoy a variety of diversions and spectacles.

This supplement describes the many forms of entertainment available, details two sinister organizations, and provides advice for making entertainer characters.Also included are three sample characters and 8 entertaining lackeys.

106789.name: Quick Picks Password  Travel Game
106789.description:
From the publisher:

Play Password, and American original. For more than 35 years, Password has been challenging players' communication skills. Teams of two square off to see who can guess the secret Password first. But you've got to be clever when you communicate because players can give only one-word clues, and the fewer clues given the higher the score! Contents: 50 Password Cards, Scoring Indicator Dial, 2 Vinyl Card Holders, Instructions, Score Pad

106790.name: Quick Picks Pyramid Travel Card Game
106790.description:
From the publisher:

Now celebrating 35 years as one of America's most popular TV game shows, The $1,000,000 Pyramid is a new version of the classic two-team word and category guessing game! Featuring 24 rounds of Pyramid and Winner's Circle play, The $1,000,000 Pyramid Quick Pick edition offers all the fun of the TV show in this convenient travel-friendly tin! Game Contents: 288 Cards with 24 Rounds of Play, Red Reveal Window, 30-Second Timer, Instruction Booklet

106792.name: World War I
106792.description:
User Summary

World War I- Real time strategy, based on historical events of 1914-1918. Based on the modified version of the Blitzkrieg engine created by Nival Interactive.

· Command three sides of the conflict: Russia, entente forces (British and French troops) and Germany (the German army also includes Dual Monarchy forces).
· Dozens of units, including heavy, siege, field and trench artillery; cavalry, infantry, tanks, airplanes, sappers and medics.
· Large-scale historic battles, such as Osovets stronghold defense and the Brusilov break-through offensive.
· Realistic, detailed military equipment of the beginning of the 20th century.

106793.name: Dandy
106793.description:
User Summary

This is a Gauntlet clone in which the player either controls Thor or Sheba. The game also features a co-op mode, where both can be played simultaneously. The player has to fight his way through 15 dungeons, while collecting treasure. Opponents start in waves from some sort of spawn boxes, which must be taken out as soon as possible to prevent yet another wave.
If all treasure is gathered, a code is granted. At the end of the game, all codes have to be puzzled together.

106794.name: Earthshock
106794.description:
User Summary

Earthshock is a futuristic, fantasy science fiction, entertaining text adventure game. You will be engrossed in robot cities, dusty plains and deep mine shafts. The events take place in a post-apocalyptic era. In a series of quests of increasing difficulty, you will pit yourself against droids who have taken over the world.

106795.name: 10 Computer Hits 4
106795.description:
User Summary

This is the Fourth of Beau Jolly's "10 Computer Hits" series. However as there are actually 12 games on this compilation, 2 are advertised on the cover as being provided "free".

106796.name: Aliens (1987)
106796.description:
User Summary

An action game that closely follows the events of the 1986 movie. The player controls a group of Colonial Marines sent to investigate the colony on LV-426. As the game progresses, the goal changes to survival. Success is measured by the number of marines left at the end of the game.

The game consists of 6 completely different stages (almost mini-games).
Stage 1: Land the dropship- a flight sim style sequence
Stage 2: Return to the APC - a side scroller/maze shoot'em up
Stage 3: Operations Room Defense - an up/down action sequence like Tapper, where you keep the Aliens away from your marines
Stage 4: Airduct Escape - a maze sequence
Stage 5: Rescue Newt - action similar to stage 2
Stage 6: Alien Queen - a 1st person view, boxing style fight

106797.name: Hot Shots Golf 2
106797.description:
While the game is very similar to the original, it does bring slight improvements. Like the game's 1997 release, there are several characters to choose from, and many more to be unlocked throughout the game. Each character has his or her own strengths and weaknesses, making character selection more than just choosing a skin. The character models themselves are more realistic looking as opposed to the big-headed anime style of the original.

Again, there are several different modes of play, from standards like Stroke, Match, and Tournament play, to the versus, through which new characters can be unlocked. Gameplay itself is a version of the standard '3 click' variety used by the majority of golf games.

This is the first game in the series to include guest characters from other games. They are Sweet Tooth from Twisted Metal, Sir Daniel Fortesque from MediEvil, and Gex from the Gex video game series. They only appeared in the American and European versions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Everybody's Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106798.name: Dark Sceptre
106798.description:
From the back of the box

Dark Sceptre will take you beyond your wildest imagination to a land of infinite possibilities and limitless adventure. 4 channel sound. 4000 locations.

User Summary

On the Islands Of The Western Sea the king orders the creation of the Dark Sceptre, to defeat the Northlanders. He is, however, defeated and his enemies grabbed the very instrument he thought to destroy them with. This sceptre must be found and destroyed.

To do so, the player commands a band of warriors. Each warrior reacts to commands like kill, protect, defend, seek, bewitch and petrify. Several orders can be given at once, and carried out in sequence.

There's one other group of warriors which are your adversaries. Another 5 groups can be your enemies or allies, depending on your actions.

106799.name: Everybody's Putter Golf with Toro
106799.description:
The game features Jasmine from Everybody's Golf 5 and stars Sony's Japanese mascot Toro, as well as his companion Kuro in a series of mini golf courses.

Source: Wikipedia, "Everybody's Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106800.name: The Secret of Smuggler's Cove
106800.description:
From the front cover:

The coastal village of Fair Haven is in need of aid! For decades, Fair Haven has relied upon its lighthouse to guide merchant vessels into port. But more recently, the lighthouse failed to light up the coastline during a violent storm and the trading ship Nymph's Kiss was dashed upon the rocks, sinking in to the murky depths. The lighthouse needs to be repaired, but the locals are too frightened by the vengeful spirits that haunt the tower. And then there are the sea saves, beneath the lighthouse tower itself ...

An Adventure for Character Levels 5-6

106801.name: Catch 23
videogameversion: UK ZX SPectrum Tape Cassette release
106801.description:
User Summary

In Catch 23 the player is parachuted above an island, containing a test development site. His mission is to find the CK23, an enemy weapon. Once found the player must steal the design and set off a nuclear bomb that will destroy the island. It's 22:00 when parachuted and the sun rises at 6:00, meaning the player has a full day (/night) work to circumvent enemy patrols, search houses for additional weapons and explosives, navigate the terrain, fences etc and reach his destination, hopefully without setting of an alarm For that end, the player has a dangerometer. Set off an alarm and the dangerometer will show an increased value. And indeed, enemy soldiers will rush to the explosion to investigate.

Enemy vehicles can be circumvented, but it's hard to avoid the foot patrols, which must be dealt with by swift and accurate gunfights.

The game uses vector graphics.

106802.name: The Kingslayers
106802.description:
From the rear cover:

The trap was sprung with great effect: an assassin lay dead in the King's bedchamber, both daggers still in hand. The King's mages quickly determined that the assassin was nothing more than an unfortunate fool - one of many - who succumbed to the will of the Kingslayers; twin daggers possessed of great power and a single minded desire to spread chaos through the death of all who would rule.

The mages could find no means of destroying the Kingslayers, and those who tried risked becoming enslaved by their fierce will. The King's most trusted advisor, Filiaren, reasoned that t if they could not be destroyed, then they must be hidden. He knew of a place, far from civilization and unmarked on any map, where the residents had no sense of leadership amongst themselves. Here it was hoped that the daggers could be guarded by those who would be swayed by the daggers' call.

For forty years, the daggers remained hidden and the world knew relative calm. Filiaren has not heard from the guardians for far too long, and his fears were confirmed when he went to investigate. The daggers are missing, and it is only a matter of time befor they continue their campaign against order.

Armed with new information suggesting that the daggers can be destroyed, Filiaren has turned to the Acaeum Adventurer's Guild to undertake a most dangerous mission: find and retrieve the Kingslayers, and carry them across the planes to the CHaos Forge to be unmade. Does this band of adventurers still have what it takes to survive a challenge of this magnitude? Will they rid the world at last of the threat of the Kingslayers, or will they succumb to the will of the daggers, becoming just another set of pawns in their murderous game?

106803.name: Prey the Stars
106803.description:
Prey the Stars (known as Gabu Gabu Planet in Japan) is a video game in which players control various dog-like creatures in a competition to eat the most items in a given level. Part of the challenge comes in that, in order to successfully eat an item, you must "chew" it by repeatedly pressing the B button.

Source: Wikipedia, "Prey the Stars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106804.name: Stop That Roach!
106804.description:
Stop That Roach! (ホイホイ ゲームボーイ版) is about an insect exterminator who must kill roaches by any means possible. This game was prominently featured in an old Nintendo Power magazine with pictures of roaches and food in the background. Despite the Nintendo Power factor, this game was hardly seen in the major commercial stores.

Source: Wikipedia, "Stop That Roach!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106805.name: Auto Test
106805.description:
User Summary

An old sit down driving game. Try to pass the driver test with your driving skill. Simple 70's graphics and gameplay.

Stand up unit plays two players. The sit down cabinet plays one.

106807.name: Avenger (Arcade)
106807.description:
User Summary

A mid 70's jet figher game from electra. Shoot planes down to score points as you scroll through the screen. Features black and white raster graphics.

106808.name: Naval Ops: Warship Gunner 2
106808.description:
Warship Gunner 2 is the sequel to the popular Naval Ops: Warship Gunner from Koei that debuted in 2003. Naval Ops: Commander, released in 2004, was based on the first game, but, because it featured a different type of gameplay featuring usable escorts, seems not to have inherited the status as the second game in the series, similar to how Koei's Samurai Warriors is based on the Dynasty Warriors gameplay. The sequel seeks to expound on the first title by revamping the visual engine, providing a new campaign and dozens of new features, and work on the bugs that held its predecessor back from being a truly great game. Featuring over 100 missions and all sorts of ships including submarines, battleships, destroyers, cruisers, and more, Warship Gunner 2 hopes to appeal to a large base of action-oriented fans.

The game is set in 1939 of an alternate universe, and thus combines technology of this period in the real world with a variety of futuristic lasers and weapons, without the "World War II-only" mode of the first game. However, the first playthrough is generally "World War II" consistent, while subsequent playthroughs feature more lasers and high-tech weapons en masse, as well as a slightly extended ending run. (After the first playthrough one can choose whether a mission played in Training will use its "1st playthrough" or "subsequent playthroughs" version, called Enemy Deployment 1 or 2.) Regardless, game balance and experience can be drastically affected by the Difficulty, the extent of the player's Parts inventory (whether picked up or R&D'd), the player's chosen ship for a mission, and how the ship was designed.

The story follows three or four officers of a Wilkia Freedom Forces naval crew Captain Schulz, Lieutenant Nagi, Commander Braun (German Federal Republic, attached to the crew), optionally with Commander Tsukuba (Japan) and Lieutenant Commander Werner (Wilkia), as they lead the resistance to the coup that overthrew their King on March 25, 1939, then declared an Empire led by Admiral Karl Weisenberger and started making war, in a manner akin to real-life Nazi Germany, albeit with the trump card of "superweapons," huge, heavily armed and armored vehicles at sea, in one case on land (a version of the Dora railway gun) and in two cases in the air. Over time, and particularly in the final mission of the second playthrough, the superweapons themselves take further prominence are more is learned about their nature, although their origins are left ambiguous. Wilika is portrayed as a colony of the Dutch that developed into a second "overseas homeland" with a separate ruling king and independent military. In effect the game consists of a group of Evil Dutchmen trying to conquer the world with advanced technology.

Although the same general story applies in all cases, there are three story paths with exclusive missions, "takes" on the story, and endings. The specific story path is chosen by the player's actions in the first two missions of the story and represented by your executive officer ("adjutant") being Werner, Tsukuba, or Braun (whose rescue and joining the FF is in all three story paths). After completing a first playthrough where Weisenberger goes down with a superweapon upon its sinking, all subsequent playthroughs have Weisenberger escaping to a superweapon submarine, then a final superweapon has to be fought in a mission whose introduction changes the general ending quite a bit.

In the game you can unlock the Zumwalt class Destroyer, as a Secret Blueprint (pre-configured ship design) which can be picked up (as a Parts crate) during the enemy deployment 1 boss battle; it does not however look like the conceptual designs of the real-life Zumwalt class, and it like destroyers and Secret Blueprint designs in general are inferior to many designs that are possible after sufficient research is done.

Source: Wikipedia, "Naval Ops: Warship Gunner 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106809.name: UFO Chase
106809.description:
User Summary

A mid '70s Electra space game. One or two players try to ram their spaceship into the oppontents and AI spaceships in attempt to blow them up and score points. Features black and white Raster graphics.

106810.name: Wings
106810.description:
User Summary

An early black and white raster 2d shooter where you and an opponent play planes. Attempt to shoot down your opponent before being shot yourself to score points.

106811.name: ABC Sports Presents: The Palm Springs Open
106811.description:
From the Game Box

Play 18 of the World's Most Famous and Challenging Holes

For the first time you control live golfers on live courses. Select your club, position your golfer, control the power, hook and slice of your swing. Featuring an amazing sound track. On every shot, two play-by-play announcers won't let you forget how you're doing. Not an animation. This is real footage of some of the most famous holes in the world - and you're there. Real picture, real play, real fun. Traps the size of the Sahara, countless water hazards, Scottish mounds, rock quarries - just another day in a golfer's paradise. It's as real as the game itself.

106812.name: Gunmetal
106812.description:
User Summary

A first person shooter set in a future controlled by corporations. You take the role of a new security guard to one of the world corporations, an attack by an ally corporation is what begins the game. A virus takes over all remote piloted vehicles, save for yours, and it falls to you to stop the virus.

106813.name: Space Rogue
106813.description:
From the back of the box:

Dropping out of hyperspace, you lay a course for Lagrange Station. Suddenly, the klaxon screams out a warning! Two Darts and a Corsiar, closing fast! Pirates! You roll hard to avoid the incoming plasma torps. One hits, knocking down your rear shield. Spinning to protect your stern, you launch a heat seeker. Direct hit: the Corsair bursts into shards. Stunned, the Darts run for deep space. Later, over a pint of Rigelian in the Lagrange cantina, you listen as a bounty hunter tells of the Scarlet Brotherhood, the most notorious band of pirates in the Far Arm. You hope it wasn't one of their Corsairs you vaporized out there...

Inspired Space Flight Simulation!

Trek through an astonishingly realistic universe with outposts and mining stations, planets and asteroids, stars and starships - all in spectacular 3D graphics.
Watch combat from cockpit, chase plane, or cinematic camera angles.
Engage cunning foes in heated dogfights, where you'll have to outgun and outsmart your opponents to taste victory.
Outfit your ship with plasma torpedoes, plasteel armor, particle beams, missiles, force shields, ECM units and more.
Execute loops, rolls, and spins. Feel the tug of gravity as you whip around a star. Authentic spaceflight dynamics push your piloting skills to the limit.




Intense Role-Playing Adventure!

Make a fortune - and a name - trading cargo, bounty hunting, or plundering merchant ships. Every action you take affects your reputation, and who calls you friend or foe.
Meet and converse with the inhabitants of the Far Arm: Imperial troopers, merchant princes, talkative robots, and treacherous pirates.
Shop for starship hardware, do favors for aliens, carouse in bars - even play HIVE!, the galaxy's hottest arcade game.
You will be drawn into a web of intrigue; secret plots, assassination attempts, intergalactic war. Ultimately, the destiny of billions will hinge on your deeds.

106814.name: Dark Horizons: Lore
videogamehonor: 2005 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
106814.description:
"The game takes place in a futuristic world in the year 2155 where several factions are battling for control over the planet. The most important of these are the Federated States and the Eastern Confederation They are fighting over "No Man's Land", what was once North America. Due to high levels of radiation, soldiers fight each other through the use of Mechanized Assault Vehicles, machines connected and remotely controlled by the minds of their pilots."

"The game is a mixture between first person shooters games such as Unreal Tournament 2004 and mecha simulation games such as MechWarrior. The player can select between two different factions and various different MAV types, with each being equipped with unique abilities and weapons. You can also customize your MAV to some extent, such as being able to trade speed for armor or vice versa. The game has support for various different playing modes, such as equivalents of Deathmatch and Capture the Flag. Players can switch between first-person or third-person view while playing the game. Although primarily focused on multiplayer, single-player is allowed through the use of computer controlled bots."

The game is currently available as a free download.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dark Horizons: Lore," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106815.name: Star Command
106815.description:
From the instruction manual introduction

Star Command is a role-playing game of the far future. You, the player, are in command of a group of eight characters of your own creation. These characters are assigned missions by Star Command, the organization that is responsible for keeping humanity safe. You must take these green troopers, equip them with what you can, and complete your missions to save mankind. This is, unfortunately, a difficult task. The galaxy at large is a dangerous place, filled with dangers of every kind imaginable, from pirate ships that will ambush you as you try to deliver food to hungry colonists, to alien creatures that you must battle your way through in order to reach your goal. As your characters complete missions, they will gain in power, allowing them to take on greater challenges.

The emphasis in Star Command, however, is not on hand-eye coordination. This is not a video game where the best reflexes win. Careful planning is required before, and during, each battle. Your crew's skills and equipment must be balanced, so that no critical skill is missing. In Star Command, good strategy can often overcome superior firepower.

In addition to combat, both in space and on the ground, Star Command emphasizes exploration and character interaction with the plotline. While your crew is exploring space stations and secret enemy bases on exotic planets, they will encounter many types of alien creatures and devices. Many are hostile, but some can be very valuable sources of information. Adventure awaits...

106816.name: Sandy's Circus Adventure
106816.description:
From the Back of the Box

Sandy, the cuddly sea lion, is lost in the circus and your child is invited along! Together they can explore all the excitement, fun and adventure of the Big Top. They can romp with the clowns, get shot out of a cannon, disappear in a magician's hat, play with jugglers and much, much more.

Sandy's Circus Adventure introduces the first interactive cartoon ever. Your child designs his or her own story. Should Sandy visit the clowns or the animals? Play with the sea lions or see what's in the magician's hat? Let your child decide. With over 50 choices, Sandy's adventures are never the same.

No instructions or manuals are necessary. All the directions and controls are right on the screen. There's even an audio "help" mode to lend kids a hand. Rich digital sound along with full color animation provide a magical play time experience. A circus for the whole family, right in your living room.

106817.name: Universe 3
106817.description:
From the back cover

After 300 years of isolation, the Local Group is about to send a diplomatic mission to Earth. Your job is to ensure that it succeeds... A very difficult job when you know that there is a traitor on your ship!

Omnitrend's Universe 3 features:

Animated movement and combat
Over 70 areas to map and explore
Dozens of objects to use and trade
Digitized sound (IBM version excluded)
Zooming for close-ups of important objects and characters
A sophisticated command interface
Dozens of characters to interact with
No previous Universe experience required
Many intriguing puzzles and situations

106818.name: Monkeys with Knives and Guns
106818.description: In Monkeys with Knives and Guns, players take control of a band of armed monkeys trying to gather bananas. Monkeys are represented by dice, and players roll dice, then determine which of their monkeys grabs a banana, kills opposing monkeys or horribly injures themselves with their deadly weapons. The player with the most bananas at the end of the game wins!

106820.name: Universe II
106820.description:
User Summary

Universe II is a sci-fi RPG / adventure game that is a continuation of the story started in Universe (1983). Gameplay revolves around space exploration, ship-to-ship combat, tactical man-to-man combat via boarding parties, goods trading, and resource mining. A text adventure game handles when players visit starports.

106821.description:
(from S&T press website:)

On 3 July 1866 the armies of Austria-Hungary and Prussia met west of the Bohemian fortress of Königgrätz (now Hradec Králové). The battle was the culmination of a quarter-century of political and military maneuvering by Otto von Bismarck, aimed at enabling Prussia to supplant Austria-Hungary as the dominant state of the coalescing German nation.

The battle is presented using the folio line’s Musket & Saber system: brigade-sized units, one-fifth-mile hexes, 90-minute turns, 280 counters. The Austro-Hungarian army, chastened by a week of minor defeats, was entrenched a long line covering the fortress of Königgrätz. It occupied a central position facing three converging Prussian armies. To win, the Prussians must sweep the Austrians off the field (as they did historically), while the Austrians must maintain a presence on the field to justify their continued claim to political primacy. The game emphasizes the differences between the armies in doctrine, weapons and morale. The Prussian triumph was born of more than just the famous needle-gun: their infantry used flexible organization and tactics to mass men quickly at the decisive point, while the Austrians used a throwback to Napoleonic column formations due to a misreading of the lesson from an earlier engagement. The Prussian artillery is outclassed by the superb Austrian guns, but can be dangerous if used properly. The Austrian cavalry is superior as well, but horsed charges were already an anachronism. In the end the battle came down to crucial command decisions, giving both players an opportunity to win.
106821.name: Koniggratz

106822.name: Up Periscope!
106822.description:
From the back of the box

You command a WWII fleet class submarine. Experience all the action of practice runs out of New London Connecticut and shakedown cruises in the North Atlantic. Go on a full-fledged war patrol out of San Francisco's Mare Island or Pearl Harbor in the Pacific Theatre.

Take your orders from COMSUBPAC (Commander Submarine Force Pacific), or go hunting on your own. Relive eight different historical situations and compare your strategies with those of real submarine commanders. When you master the daytime periscope-depth attack, move on to the dangerous and skill-demanding night surface patrol. Adjustable time scales and reality modes (from Practice to Advanced) ensure continuous action and challenge.

Up Periscope! includes extensive realistic equipment; surface and attack radars, variable-power periscope, torpedo data computer, and much more. Armament supplies include everything from a selection of old reliable Mark 10s to advanced wakeless (but unproven) Mark 18 torpedoes that can be fired from both fore and aft torpedo tubes. Use detailed Pacific and Atlantic charts to plot your course and navigate right to the action. But be careful not to get rammed or depth-charged by enemy ships, depicted in truly unprecedented 3D detail. And try to avoid the embarrassment of sinking one of your own Allied ships or running aground on an uncharted Pacific atoll.

106823.name: Dungeon Master's Mat Set
106823.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gale Force Nine's Official DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game Mats are high-quality single-sided vinyl surfaces that are ideal battle grids for staging encounters during your adventures! The mats lie flat for ease of play and are sold in a sturdy polycarbonate tube for easy storage and transport. The mats may be marked with WET-ERASE markers to temporarily alter terrain areas or make other notes about battlefield conditions during play. The Game Mats measure 20" x 30" and are marked with a 1" grid.

The Dungeon Master's Mat Set contains TWO vinyl game mats to stage your own encounters and adventures. The first mat is a simple 1" grid of stone tiles, the basic dungeon environment. With this mat, a DM can mark walls, doors and other dungeon features using a wet-erase marker. This mat will be the staple battle grid for any indoor encounter. The other mat is a green grass field; ideal for staging outdoor confrontations. Like the other mats, a few quick marks from a wet-erase pen customizes the mat with whatever elements the encounter calls for; add a tree line, forest path or campsite. The Dungeon Master’s Mat Set is an indispensible tool for every DM!

Gale Force Nine recommends the use of water-soluble marking pens, like those used with overhead projectors (wet-erase markers) with our game mats. Vinyl is a very porous material and any marks make by dry-erase or permanent markers will stain the mat.

106824.name: Gulp
106824.description:
Take on the role of a village in an ancient River Boggle civilization, a people who grew food in their mouth while standing in water for months on end!

Compete with other villages as you harvest and store crops for winter, but avoid being seen by your gods as too greedy!

The center of your world is a five-card, poker-like river. There are simple tools at your disposal, but as Boggles had no need to develop complicated industrial agriculture, those tools are limited to what can be done with the people of your village--like redirecting the River by linking together to form a Boggle blockade, or changing the contents of the River by having a bunch of Boggles slurp it up while another group spit in new elements.

Water crops. Yum!

106825.name: Arcane Power: Bard Power Cards
106825.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Players using Arcane Power Cards don't need to crack open a rulebook every time they sling a spell -- all the crucial information is right in front of their eyes. Simply select the cards for your character's powers and you're ready to play!

Each deck of 100 cards includes all the powers from Arcane Power for one of the five classes featured in the book -- swordmage, bard, wizard, warlock, and sorcerer -- plus a few blank cards for players to use for other powers.

106826.name: Arcane Power: Sorcerer Power Cards
106826.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Players using Arcane Power Cards don't need to crack open a rulebook every time they sling a spell -- all the crucial information is right in front of their eyes. Simply select the cards for your character's powers and you're ready to play!

Each deck of 100 cards includes all the powers from Arcane Power for one of the five classes featured in the book -- swordmage, bard, wizard, warlock, and sorcerer -- plus a few blank cards for players to use for other powers.

106827.name: Arcane Power: Warlock Power Cards
106827.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Players using Arcane Power Cards don't need to crack open a rulebook every time they sling a spell -- all the crucial information is right in front of their eyes. Simply select the cards for your character's powers and you're ready to play!

Each deck of 100 cards includes all the powers from Arcane Power for one of the five classes featured in the book -- swordmage, bard, wizard, warlock, and sorcerer -- plus a few blank cards for players to use for other powers.

106828.name: Arcane Power: Wizard Power Cards
106828.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Players using Arcane Power Cards don't need to crack open a rulebook every time they sling a spell -- all the crucial information is right in front of their eyes. Simply select the cards for your character's powers and you're ready to play!

Each deck of 100 cards includes all the powers from Arcane Power for one of the five classes featured in the book -- swordmage, bard, wizard, warlock, and sorcerer -- plus a few blank cards for players to use for other powers.

106829.name: Arcane Power: Swordmage 1 Power Cards
106829.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Players using Arcane Power Cards don't need to crack open a rulebook every time they sling a spell -- all the crucial information is right in front of their eyes. Simply select the cards for your character's powers and you're ready to play!

Each deck of 100 cards includes all the powers from Arcane Power for one of the five classes featured in the book -- swordmage, bard, wizard, warlock, and sorcerer -- plus a few blank cards for players to use for other powers.

106830.name: Arcane Power: Swordmage 2 Power Cards
106830.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Players using Arcane Power Cards don't need to crack open a rulebook every time they sling a spell -- all the crucial information is right in front of their eyes. Simply select the cards for your character's powers and you're ready to play!

Each deck of 100 cards includes all the powers from Arcane Power for one of the five classes featured in the book -- swordmage, bard, wizard, warlock, and sorcerer -- plus a few blank cards for players to use for other powers.

106831.name: Xenos
106831.description:
From the introduction

Xenos™ is an intriguing and complex adventure. Your mission is to explore Purgatory and its surrounding desert, find whatever has left the town deserted, and destroy it before it wreaks havoc on anything else. You could become a hero or a small pile of ashes. What happens is up to your skill in logic and your ability to make use of any equipment you might find.

106832.name: Zelda's Adventure
106832.description:
User Summary

Zelda's Adventure for the CD-I was the third and final Zelda game to be released for the console. The game was played via a top down perspective like that found in The Legend of Zelda, rather than the side scrolling perspective found in Zelda II or the other Zelda CD-I games.

You play as Princess Zelda throughout the game and adventure on a world map while exploring individual dungeons and looking for celestial signs in an effort to save Link from Ganon. Zelda's Adventure is also the only Zelda game to use live action cut scenes to tell the story.

106833.name: Top Management
106833.description:
Famicom Top Management (ファミコン トップマネジメント, "NES Top Management") is a Family Computer business simulation video game that turns the player into a highly respected corporate title holder.

Using the management skills provided by the game, he/she must turn his/her fledgling corporation (会社 kaisha) into a profitable super corporation. Created by Koei, the game was geared towards Japanese business students in high school, college, and university. Literacy in the Japanese language is required in addition to advanced arthimetic skills. Famicom Top Management features abstract art that serves as the game's graphics.The game is mostly text-based and players can choose between five major electronics companies to play as (IBM, Fujitsu, Toshiba, Sharp, and NEC). Like most business games, bankruptcy ends the game with a game over.

Source: Wikipedia, "Famicom Top Management", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106834.name: Savage: The Ultimate Quest for Survival
106834.description:
User Summary

In Savage: The Ultimate Quest for Survival, you play as a lion that must hunt down prey, and even tourists, to survive in the wild. There are ten levels in the game, each with their own objectives and goals. Upon completing a level, you are given a score that compares how you did with the par for the level.

The game also includes a learning mode that teaches you about lions and their behavior via documentary style video clips.

106835.name: Top Management II
106835.description:
Top Management II (トップマネジメントⅡ) is a Super Famicom video game that emphasizes strategy and economic expansion.

As a corporate executive, players must keep their corporation profitable by any means possible. The entire game is in Japanese; making it mandatory to be able to read the language. Frequent corporate meetings keep players aware of what is happening within the company. A typical game of Top Management begins in the year 1980.

Source: Wikipedia, "Top Management II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106836.description:
For the tenth anniversary of H@LL9000.de, the site's feline mascot Hallbert invites you to participate in Ostfriesisches Schafe-Schubsen (East Frisian Sheep Hustle).

In this game the sheep compete in a lively race, which is, alas, not always free of small dirty tricks. While the sheep struggle on the dyke for the best positions, Hallbert is hiding and intends to scare the slowest sheep so that it flops off the dyke.

Meanwhile, the sheep are no angels and are hustling for positions, with all of them wanting to shove their fellow racers onto slippry ground. Those who have a lifesaver are the lucky ones that can continue the race. Without a lifesaver, any sheep sliding down the dyke is doomed to watch the race from a distance. When only two sheep remain on the dyke, the race ends and an award ceremony takes place; according to East Frisian tradition, the most fearless sheep that has not aimlessly rushed forward wins the race - thus, the runner-up is really the winner!

Ostfriesisches Schafe-Schubsen, which will appear in an edition of 500 copies, is being sold on a non-profit basis, with neither the game designers nor the graphic designers earning money from the game.
106836.name: Ostfriesisches Schafe-Schubsen

106837.name: A Night in Nylon City
106837.description:
User Summary

A Night in Nylon City is an adult oriented educational video game all about nylon.

The game contains a virtual city with buildings that the player can walk through and enter. Inside each of the buildings is a different activity. Some buildings contain mini games and others contain video clips, historical facts or documents.

106838.name: Axis Assassin
106838.description:
From the back of the box

The Army of the Master Arachnid.
It attacks without reason.
Destroys without remorse.
Hunters. Spinners. Mutant Guards.
The savage Xterminators.
Nothing will prepare you.
Nothing will save you.
Only the Axis Assassin.

User Summary

This is an arcade action game styled on the classic game TEMPEST.

106839.name: Pop Cutie! Street Fashion Simulation
106839.description:
Known in Japan as That's QT, the player is put in charge of a fashion boutique, and is required to design, and sell clothes. Making clothes requires collecting keywords, which certain combination of words creates certain pieces of clothing. To sell your clothes, you must set up a store, and stock it with your items, as well as hire employees to take care of the store. You are set against rivals, who like you are selling clothes. In game you can also take part in "fashion battles", in which you are put against a rival to design an outfit based on a certain amount of items. Your outfit is then judged on several criteria.

The game is broke into several stages, in which you must meet a certain objective to get to the next stage. In different stages your store is located in a different part of town, as well, the size of your store also changes, as well as your rivals.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pop Cutie! Street Fashion Simulation," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106841.name: Barricade
106841.description:
User Summary

Barricade is similar to many of the 'snake' games of the day. Gameplay is like a simplified version of the Tron Lightcycles, but in black and white and simple graphics.

Up to four players try to wall off their opponents and try to be the last one to crash.

106842.name: Clean sweep (Arcade)
106842.description:
User Summary

Clean Sweep is Ramtek's version of a 4 person Pong game. Graphics are black and white Raster as is typical with the age.

106844.name: Deluxe Baseball
106844.description:
User Summary

Deluxe Baseball is an early era arcade baseball game by Ramtek. Play the popular American baseball game. It hosts a 3/4 view from behind home plate with simple black and white graphics.

106845.name: GT Roadster
106845.description:
User Summary

GT Roadster is a simple late 70's race game with Black and white graphics and a color overlay. 1-2 players race against each other and time in the hopes of getting a higher score. Game uses shifting as well.

106846.name: Hit Me
106846.description:
User Summary

An early Black Jack Arcade game. Play against other players to try to get the most chips.

106847.name: Hockey
106847.description:
User Summary

A very early pong like arcade game. Instead of the whole side of the screen open, there is a smaller section that is the 'goal.' The game itself doesn't look like hockey, with the exception of the cabinet art.

106848.name: M-79 Ambush
106848.description:
User Summary

M-79 Ambush is a one to 2 player lightgun shooter where you use your gun to shoot enemy tanks and motorcycles.Try to get the high score by shooting the most targets. Features black and white raster graphics.

106849.name: Sea Battle (Arcade)
106849.description:
User Summary

Sea Battle is a 1-4 player competitive game where you try to shoot other players ships with your ship. Last man standing is the winner. Score points for kills.

106850.name: Leading Company
106850.description:
Leading Company is a construction-oriented strategy video game that was released for both the Super Famicom (SNES) and the NEC PC-9801. The traditional definition of a leading company is a corporation that currently dominates the "corporate wars" against their competitors. Its employees are considered by most people to be winning the "rat race."

Both versions of this game were released to an exclusively Japanese market. However, the NEC PC-9801 version has sharper graphics and the ability to use a mouse. Instead of abstract colors (to depict control of each square of the board), buildings are used to depict a typical Japanese residential neighborhood. A theme park is visibily shown on an island in the PC-9801 version to depict recreational opportunities.

Source: Wikipedia, "Leading Company", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106851.name: Soccer (arcade)
106851.description:
User Summary

Soccer is basically a two team pong with a space in the outer box line for a goal. Can be played by 1- 4 players in competitive teams. The game features black and white raster graphics with a soccer themed cabinet.

106852.name: Star Cruiser
106852.description:
User Summary

Star Cruiser is a very early head to head 2d shooter where you try to shoot your opponents space ship with yours. The game features black and white raster graphics and extremely simple game play.

106853.name: A Harvesting Moon
106853.description:
User Summary

A Harvesting Moon is a graphic text adventure set in a huge and peculiar old building called Moreton Manor. You are on a sightseeing tour with your parents when you accidentally get lost. You now have to explore the house, find your way and get back together with them before tea time.

106854.name: Wipe Out
106854.description:
User Summary

Wipe out is another 4 person pong like game where you try to not get your score to 0, while trying to bounce the 'ball' into your opponents goal.

106855.name: D-Bug
106855.description:
from the back of the box

The computer’s down and it’s up to you to fix it. Well, it’s up to you and an expert named Charlie Fixit. But that doesn’t mean it’s easy. Not by a long shot.

Start by crawling inside. That’s right. Into the computer. Stray charges called "transients" zap around your head. Be careful you don’t become charged with static electricity or you’ll burn out the parts you touch. And make sure you keep your eyes open. Remember, you’re in here to find what’s wrong. You’ve got to learn to spot faulty chips, bad connections, clogged fans.

It sounds tough. And it is. But it’s not that bad. After all, we’ve seen parents play it. One of them even won once.

A SPECIAL WORD TO PARENTS. D-Bug is a wonderful way to introduce your children -– and you -– to the terminology and basic workings of computers. But beyond this specific knowledge, players also learn to link causes and effects, and to develop their own strategies for solving problems. We are constantly surprised by the ingenious solutions matter-of-factly tossed off by he very young.

106856.name: Martian Raider
106856.description:
User Summary

Martian Raider is a side-scrolling arcade shooter similar to Defender. Players must destroy alien spacecraft as well as ground units and bases. Points are awarded for shooting enemies as well as for elapsed time played.

106857.name: Word Flyer
106857.description:
from the back of the box

Is this picture worth a thousand words?

Indeed. It is worth a lot more than one thousand, in fact. For the vocabulary of ‘Word Flyer’ numbers well over 2,000.

It’s a formidable vocabulary for a game -– or even for a person, when you think about it. But don’t let that frighten you. These words are easy and friendly. They zoom and fly. And there are birds to keep you company.

Pick a word and match it with a zooming word. Simple? Yes, but then there are hazards. Clouds obscure the zooming words. Nonsense words try to confuse and tempt you. And as you get better, the game gets faster.

But take heart. In time, you will succeed. And when you do, we’ve arranged a very special surprise.

A SPECIAL WORD TO PARENTS. Children don’t have to be able to read to be able to play ‘Word Flyer’. In fact, if a child is able to operate a computer joystick, he or she is probably old enough to enjoy this game. Lower levels teach children the alphabet. Upper levels teach more complex pattern and word recognition, spelling, vocabulary, and pre-reading skills. Moreover, we have seen ‘Word Flyer’ prompt many children to use a dictionary for the first time, to learn about new and unfamiliar ‘flyers’.

106858.name: Shark Trap
106858.description:
User Summary

Qix-like arcade game in which the player uses nets to try to rope off a large portion of the screen in order to advance to the next level. Four sharks patrol the area and will attack/kill the player if the player gets too close to them. The sharks can be roped off into smaller areas of the screen, but if the player is not quick about finishing the level they will break free and destroy the player's nets. Two octopi are dropped in on some levels to add additional difficulty.

106859.name: The Raven
106859.description:
User Summary

In The Raven you are Sherlock Holmes and another complicated, mind boggling mystery is at hand. Your host, Doctor Vybes, physician of the criminally insane, has invited you to his manor at a remote village where a murder has been committed. You must now put the pieces of the mystery together and find the culprit, trying not to become a corpse yourself in the process.

106860.name: Rakion
106860.description:
Rakion is on-line ‘strategy action game'
The game focuses on intense sword on sword battles with RPG style characters and settings, along with the strategic battle plans to provide the ultimate battle experience.

Like any good console games, Rakion delivers video game quality action.
You can now experience the palm sweating battles of console games online. Gamers can improve their combat skills and work out several strategies to win the battle alone as a team.

Just like a MMORPG, the concept of gaining experience points and leveling up exists in Rakion as well.
Through the level-up system, you can upgrade your character’s skills and equipment as well as your summons. Summoned creatures will become much stronger as you level up.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106861.name: Skelvullyn Twine
106861.description:
User Summary

Skelvullyn Twine is a fantasy text adventure video game set in the peaceful village of Skerrig. You are Tam Wold, Prefect of Skerrig. The people of Skerrig are being tormented by a terrible draught. Tolan, the only person who holds the secret of rain, has gone missing and you have to find him. So think hard and overcome various obstacles as it is only Tolan who can restore the river to its previous state.

106862.name: Hellcat Ace
106862.description:
From the back of the box

Hellcat Ace is an exciting and challenging three dimensional combat flying simulation of World War II air battles in the Pacific. The game player sits in the cockpit of a WWII fighter and uses the realistic out-of-the-cockpit graphic view to maneuver his aircraft through a series of combat fighter tactics. The game is played in a three dimensional airspace. The objective is to establish a machine gun firing position on the enemy aircraft and shoot it down. However, the enemy aircraft can and will outmaneuver the game player and shoot him down! This is no "Sunday Flying" simulation! It requires the concentration and hand-eye coordination of real combat fighter pilot flying!

Fourteen combat scenarios from Pearl Harbor to Iwo Jima and four different skill levels are available. The game features bailouts, ocean ditching, limited ammunition, night missions, and combat flying maneuvers. One to four players can compete in this exciting simulation for the distinction of being the World's Greatest Fighter Pilot! Step up to this challenge and show you have the "Right Stuff" of a real combat fighter pilot!

106863.name: Combat Hero Adventures
106863.description:
User Summary

Combat Hero Adventures is a run-and-gun web browser game. Players control Max as he fights his way across the galaxy to avenge his family.

106864.name: Conflict in Vietnam
videogamehonor: 1986 Golden Joystick Best Strategy Game of the Year Winner
106864.description:
The third and final game in Microprose's Command Series.

From Publisher Catalog

The significance of the struggle for Vietnam is just beginning to emerge as time gives us the luxury of hindsight. CONFLICT IN
VIETNAM provides a detailed recreation of five battle scenarios that altered the course of history in Southeast Asia; but this
time you command the action. Extensively researched, this strategic simulation challenges your tactical abilities on battlefronts from Dien Bien Phu to Saigon. Discover what might have happened if the French forces at Dien Bien Phu had American air support, or select the historically accurate scenario and see if a different strategy could have altered the
outcome. You direct the flanking movements, the counterattacks and the artillery bombardments, and you worry about the supply shortages, the weather and the morale of your men.

106865.name: Commando
106865.description:
User Summary

Assist the allies in WWII. Super deformed characters star, power up your weapons, use your platforming skills, and kill the enemies before they kill you.

106866.name: Top Gunner Collection
106866.description:
User Summary

A collection three previously released MicroProse flight games:

Hellcat Ace
MIG Alley Ace
Air Rescue

106867.name: Air Rescue I
106867.description:
User Summary

Update of Chopper Rescue rewritten in machine code. It enhanced game play by increasing the patrol zone of the mobile drones and modifying some of the fonts and graphics.

106868.name: Chopper Rescue
106868.description:
User Summary

Sid Meier's first game for Microprose. It is an arcade shooter where the player pilots a helicopter throughout a maze to rescue prisoners. The maze contains drones and gun emplacements which attempt to shoot the helicopter down. The helicopter shoots missiles and bombs to destroy the enemy units. The helicopter crashes if it runs out of fuel or if the player collides with a wall. It has a co-op mode where one player pilots the helicopter while the other fires the missiles and bombs.

106869.name: Hoyle Casino 3D
106869.description:
From the box:

Experience the thrill of a casino in the comfort of your own home. Hoyle®, the premiere name in casino games, places you there with 40 of your favorite casino games.

106870.name: 4x4 Dice
106870.description:
A fun little time-waster with a hint of strategy. You just need a piece of paper, a pen, a die, and your wits.

Draw a grid, then fill it up with die values as they are rolled. Your score increases based on your positioning of the values and where the pips end up. Add a bonus "house rules" score... and highest score wins.

(please see the files list below for the rules in PDF form)

106871.name: Bzzzz....
106871.description:
Players use a magnetic spider attached to a plastic branch via a string (web) to catch bugs on platform that vibrates, thereby making the bugs jitter all over.

Bugs and spiders are colour coded. The player to catch the 3 bugs of their colour wins!

The game may also be played non-competitively, using the bugs as a counting tool (how many bugs did you catch?) or a colour recognition and instructional tool (can you catch all the red bugs?).

106872.name: Michael Andretti's Indy Car Challenge
106872.description:
Michael Andretti's Indy Car Challenge is a Super Nintendo Entertainment System video game that is sponsored by Michael Andretti. The game features Champ Car (now called IndyCar) action. There are many modes of play including single race, season mode, and the option to disable the sound and/or music. One or two players can join in on the action. The game is roughly based on the 1994 CART World Series season and the viewpoint is from a third-person perspective.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Andrettis_Indy_Car_Chal...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106873.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – Echoes from the Past
106873.description:
Star Trek The Next Generation: Echoes from the Past is chiefly a top-down adventure game, though it also has pronounced strategy and puzzle-solving elements. It takes place in the Star Trek universe, spanning Federation space and the Romulan Neutral Zone, and centers around the appearance of the IFD (Integrated Field Derandomizer), an artifact machine of unknown origin that, as its name suggests, allows its user to reshape matter and energy. It culminates in the IFD Trials, three tests undertaken by representatives of any races that are present when the Trials are held, and failure would mean the destruction of the Federation and the enslavement of countless worlds by the Federation's enemies.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek:_The_Next_Generation:_Echoes_from_the_Past," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106874.name: Harukanaru Toki no Naka de
106874.description:
Harukanaru Toki no Naka de (遙かなる時空の中で Within the Expanse of a Distant Time) is an otome adventure game developed by Ruby Party and published by Koei. It is a part of Ruby Party's Neoromance label.

The world of Harukanaru Toki no Naka de is based on the height of the Heian Period of Japanese history, and many aspects of Heian culture, as described in the great literature of the time, are depicted in the game.

Because of Harukanaru Toki no Naka de's success, the game has give rise to a franchise including several sequels, numerous drama and music CDs, a manga series, two OAVs, a movie, and an anime TV series, and a live-action theatrical.

Harukanaru Toki no Naka de places the player in the role of a girl who is surrounded by attractive young men, and gives her the option of trying to win the heart of one and live happily ever after. The heroine must also fight evil with the help of the attractive young men. The result is a hybrid game with an visual novel-like interaction mode, a simple CRPG battle mode, and a board game-like map.

Haruka is made up of ten chapters, eight of which involve the core gameplay. These chapters take place over a 2 week period and involve traveling around the Kyō map, searching for various key items. Kyō is made up of roughly 20 areas and it is possible to visit three in one day. However, most areas are possessed by onryō (怨霊 vengeful ghosts) that must be dispelled before you can enter, and fighting them consumes one of the three visit chances.

Haruka's battle system is limited in comparison to most CRPGs of its day. The maximum party size is 3 characters, but only Akane is under the direct control of the player. Though Akane can attack and defend, her other abilities - the use of healing items and spells, and the ability to encourage her comrades, are more useful. There is no magic point system as such. Casting spells is based on the morale of the Hachiyō members and the number of elemental fuda (札) cards Akane has. Furthermore, there is no experience system and the character's hit points are refilled automatically between fights. The main reward for fighting, besides gaining entrance to a given area, is the chance to gain the trust of Hachiyō. The greater a Hachiyō member's rapport with Akane, the more effective he will be in battle.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harukanaru Toki no Naka de", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary

Perhaps a better translation of the title would be Haruka in Once upon a Time [時空]. .

106875.name: Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 2
106875.description:
Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 2 takes place 100 years after the prior game, Harukanaru Toki no Naka de. Kyō, which resembles Kyoto in the Heian period, is in turmoil because of a power struggle going on between the emperor and the retired emperor, and the people of Kyō are falling into desperation, fearing the coming of the end of the world. Karin, a modern-day high school girl, is summoned to be the Ryūjin no Miko (龍神の神子 Priestess of the Dragon God) who will save Kyō. However, there is already a Ryūjin no Miko in Kyō who has been recognized by the retired emperor, and the eight men chosen as Karin's Hachiyō (八葉) do not believe that Karin is really the Miko.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106876.name: Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3
videogameexpansion: Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3: Izayoiki
Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3: Unmei no Labyrinth
106876.description:
One rainy day Nozomi Kasuga and her two friends encounter a strange boy at their high school, who sends them hurtling across time and space to a place in another world called Kyō. This place bears a strong resemblance to Kyoto at the end of the Heian period, where the Minamoto clan (Genji), led by Minamoto no Yoritomo (based on the historical Minamoto no Yoritomo), is at war with the Taira clan (Heike), led by Taira no Kiyomori (based on the historical Taira no Kiyomori). The Heike hope to defeat the Genji by releasing vengeful spirits (onryō) to disturb the Earth's natural flow of energies and to terrorize the land. The boy that Nozomi met is revealed to be the human form of Hakuryū, the White Dragon God said to protect Kyō, whose powers have greatly weakened due to the presence of the onryō. Nozomi discovers that she has the power to seal the onryō as Hakuryū no Miko (白龍の神子 Priestess of the White Dragon), and she allies herself with the Genji in order to seal the onryō, restore Hakuryū's powers, and return home to her own world.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106878.name: Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3: Izayoiki
106878.description:
This interactive fiction gaiden game builds on the story of Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3 and is entitled Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3: Izayoiki (遙かなる時空の中で3 十六夜記, In a Distant Time 3: Chronicle of the Sixteen-Day-Old Moon) or more simply Izayoiki. It brings two more characters into the storyline: Kenji Hamada (浜田 賢二) and Kōsuke Toriumi (鳥海浩輔).

Source: Wikipedia, "Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106879.name: The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron Boy Genius: Jet Fusion (GBA)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
106879.description:
The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron Boy Genius: Jet Fusion is a video game released in 2003 based on the animated TV series The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius as well as the telefilm of the same name. In the game, the player controls Jimmy Neutron who has to save the movie star/spy Jet Fusion by using a variety of gadgets and inventions.
The next game in the Jimmy Neutron series is Attack of the Twonkies.
